text: Bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a white head. Aroma sour raspberries, quite funky, heavy sour, slight vinegar, light stone. Taste is heavy heavy sour, raspberries, slight lacto, raspberry, vinegar.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2016 New year tasting at Thomas. Cloudy pale orange with a small white head. Aroma of raspberry with a touch of funk. Dry and sour flavour with raspberry. Unpleasant sour, but with a nice and clean character

Thank you Mathieu87 + PriorL for the effort! Growler sampled @ Samson en Geert Bierproef Avond. Deep very bright head, very pretty bright colour, zero head, looks flat. Nose is very mineral, huge interesting mineral profile, mineral stones, strongly lactic with huge amount of raspberry pits in the background. Taste is very mineral, raspberry pits, touch watery possible due to it being close to flat, mineral stones, hugely lactic raspberry, acidic, mineral, faintest dash of vinegar, nicely puckering. Strongly lactic mineral body, near flat. Very solid, interesting, pleasantly puckering. Looking back at my rating & going by memory, I liked this one more than the 2012 version that I tried in 2013.

375 ml bottle 2015 "All Hopped up" label. Thank you Brian! Crystal clear golden color, no head. Nose is sharp acidic notes, funky oak, and funky raspberry. 
Taste is very acidic at this point, moldy oak, and musty basement dust. The aftermath is very acidic. I see the appeal but not really for me. Sharp tannic aftertaste.
Poured from 375ml bottle thanks Willrunforbeer 2015 orange pink with a thin white head. Aromas of tart funk raspberry oak and mild citrus. Taste is oak berry grapeskin mineral. Ok not my style.

375ml bottle from trade. Thanks Bytemesis! 2015 bottle "All Hopped Up. Pours pinkish orange gold with an off white ring. Aroma is tart raspberry jam and oak. Flavor is sharp tart raspberry, lemon, slight funk, slight grass. A hint of oak in the finish A nice raspberry sour.
Draught at Monks Cafe. Pinkish in body with tartness raspberry and some wine notes.

Purchased this summer. Let this one sit for a few more years. Smells great - heavy fruit, sweetness, light hidden funk. Glowing deep pinkish red, white head with serious fingers. Flavor is much the same as the nose, but so artificial tasting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy App
Taste at pub. This is the beer for the buddy you bring along that doesnt like anything other then light beer. Its a start I guess. Just your basic blonde ale.

Bottle at Kebabfesten. Almost clear deep pink liquid with medium pinkish head. Aroma of raspberries, lemon, mineral, light wood, red apple skin and light funk. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of raspberries, lemon and red apples. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Awesome. Great complexity, the world class RR sour base shines through in a nice way with the mineral really taking some place.

Bottle shared at the August THT.
Thin off white head. Murky pinky red pour. Sour raspberry aftertaste.

Sampled at THT August. Bottle vintage 2015, thanks kermis. Hazy orange, white head. Sweet raspberry, little horseblanket, wood, grapestones, salty minerallikeness. Mild sour and minerallike salty. Sweet and dense fruity base underneath. under medium body, soft fizzy carbonation, very nice.

Bottle at THT thanks to kermis. Bit hazy pink orange with small off white head. Nice nose with funk and raspberries. When sipping its more mineral, hay, balsamico, old red wine, lots of tannins and raspberry. Under medium sour and lots of bitter tannins. Medium bodied.
Bottle shared at August THT. Hazy peach with a thin white head. Notes of raspberries, macerated fruit, light vinegar. Medium body, light carbonation and a sour and lightly sweet finish.
Draught beer at the taproom. Very impressive. I like this beer a lot. Definitely have it back.

2015 bottle from Mr. Joenugs, shared with Nelson on 6/25/16. Thanks, Joe!Bright, light magenta-tinted raspberry body is well-carbonated and topped by a pink-tinged, light beige head that shows moderate to moderately strong retention.Raspberry is quite straightforward, with lots of flesh and seed. Vanilla creeps in, deepening complexity as a burst of phenols and leathery brett notes add livliness. No sign of the chardonnay in the nose, nor is there any strong oak, with only a touch of light wood. No alcohol or flaw.Similarly flavored, with tight carbonation and an ample, dry body. Lots of phenols and moderate vanilla with soft wood tannins and plentiful brett. The fruit is nicely attenuated as well, and leaves lots of pepper and poignant juiciness. A touch understated and quite elegant if not exactly mind-blowing.

From notes. Enjoyed this at Dougs house for a small gathering on May 01 with Travis, ebone1988, and I think Charlie made an appearance as well. Doug cracked this 375 mL bottle. Damn. The pour is a bright reddish pink color with a light pink head that falls slowly. There is a good amount of sediment to this one, thats for sure. The aroma smells like sour raspberries. There is a little funkiness and a bit of dusty barnyard to it, but the tart, sharp raspberries are the big show. The flavor is even better. There is a nice sharp fruit up front, and then it moves through a nice funky barnyard and into a sweet fruit on the back end. This one actually makes my mouth water a little, and I love it. The mouth feel is excellent. Its light and crisp with a sharp carbonation and a lovely tart raspberry finish. Im just blown away by how simple, yet excellent this is.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, Travis, and Doug. Aroma is raspberry, funk, tart, really nice. Appearance is red pink, light pink head, floaties throughout. Taste is raspberry, tart, funky, lots of barnyard, dry. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, raspberry funk aftertaste. Overall, this one is outstanding.

Sour barrel aged framboise, thanks Bart for sharing. Medium thick, off-white, more or less stable head, milky straw blonde colour with peachy hue. Complex aroma of sour yoghurt, lemo zest, starfruit, indeed sour yellow raspberry, white grape peel, raw rhubarb, sorrel, chalk, unripe gooseberry, some wet wood. Strong sour berry onset but not necessarily raspberry: some faint hints of yellow raspberry pierce through an otherwise estery, lactic and mildly citric sour whole with impressions of lime, gooseberry, starfruit and unripe green plum, softish carbo, lean pale malt body lurking underneath ongoing drying tartness and esteriness, long finish of drying acidity, fermenting hay- and yoghurt-like accents and drying wood notes. Beautiful, less known perhaps than the classic Russian River sours but certainly in the same league.

Pours very clear... sorta orangish pink.. fizzy white head has only okay retention and leaves splotch lacing... but the clarity and color of the brew is very pretty.

Nose is better than I was hoping for.. Pungent sour notes punctuated by fantastic fresh fruit aromas all pulled together by just enough sweetness... wonderful.

Flavor has a bit less raspberry flavor because it seems to be blown out by copious amounts of bretty funk and lesser lactic/lemon notes. The raspberry is more than present though.. and seems enhanced by a minor acetic quality that isnt out of place and really adds to the fruity qualities... really not that "sour", just bracingly tart... later pours proved a tad tannic.. but whos complaining?

Dry and not puckering.... I think a minor bit more residual sweetness would pull this one together more .. but that is a 1% complaint... an epic brew for sure.

Refrigerated 12.7 oz. brown bottle poured into a snifter. Clear pink with small off-white. Aroma is tart raspberry, medium body, medium carbonation, and small-bubble lacing. Taste is tart raspberries, some oak, and dryer finish.

2013 vintage bottle shared by a friend. Poured a slight hazy light amber colour with a slight white ring on top. Nose is still bursting with an amazing aroma of perfectly balanced framboise notes, spiced acidity notes, sour tannic oak, dried apricots, wet oak, tart, hay, bitter grape skin pulp, dust, not a lot of spiced Brett yeast. Mouthfeel is quite amazing with a very well balance of tart funk and raspberries. Nice!

2014 bottle thanks to Bacterial from a trade close to a year ago. When I opened the box the first thing my pregnant wife said to me was "save that one for me." So I did, and tonight (well, Friday night) was the night. Happened to have it alongside a 2015 bottle which was fun. I was fully expecting the "all hopped up" character to have faded and this to be missing something, but I was pleasantly surprised to find it was the opposite. 2015 was brilliant, red clear. Smelled like raspberry jam, more sweet than tart; tasted almost artificial, and reminded me about what I dont really like in some of these fruited sours. The 2014, on the other hand, was really lovely. Raspberry jam was still there in the nose, but with a full, deep, lovely wild funk to back it up. Sweetness restrained, nice tart, oaky, leathery backing. By far preferred the 2014 treatment [4.1] to the 2015 treatment [3.7]. Im rating this with the 4.1 because Im generous like that.

Very kind beer folk shared these beers.
2014 bottle - faded pink color, cant see through it. Raspberry jam aroma. Flavor is much less jammy and drying with tartness, very drying. End is so dry and sour but no acetic quality. 838416

2015  bottle - much brighter, neon pink-red color. Aroma is a bit like  unsweet raspberry soda. Flavor is not sour but fruit tart and unsweetened. Fun but not the cool dryness and sourness of the 2014. 747315. Final score is a combo of both ratings.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Bottle. Pink color, slightly hazy, with an off white head. Lots of juicy raspberry, tart citrus (grapefruit, lemon), oak, sour acidicity, hay, and lightly funky. Yum!
2015 bottle. Poured a ruby / pinkish with a pinkish head. Nice fruity raspberries. Funky, tart, some wood, and citrus. One I could drink all day long.
2013 bottle shared by a friend. Clear blush pink pour with a thin white head. Aroma of raspberry, funk and vinegar. Malty flavor with sour citrus and raspberry before a sour vinegar finish.

Bottle. Pours salmon pink with nice white head. Aroma is strong of raspberry, lacto, hay, citrus. Taste is sour throughout, light bodied, acidic, not much brett going on, high carbonation. Overall, very delicious.
2015 - Draft at Monks. This was excellent. slightly hazy pink with mild effervescence shooting raspberry essence into your head. Wonderful balance of fresh fruit, tartness, and malt.
End of a 2015 bottle cheers to the K man; cloudy pink pour with a bubbly white head, aroma has lemon and tart raspberry, taste has tart berries, sharp citrus, bitter grapefruit.

Bottle. Pours a light pink, fine carbonation gives a fizzy heads that fades to wispy lace. Aromas of light raspberry, light funk, light pale malt, some underripe fruit, oak and hay follow behind. Taste is delicate on the palate. Light raspberry, lightly tart. Light body and fine carbonation push some oak and light vanilla sweetness in the backend. Finishes fairly dry and lightly tart with hints of raspberries and oak. Nice beer!!

375ml 2013 vintage bottle pours orange with faint pink tint and a finger of fizzy foam. Nose is sharp acidic, dusty oak, citrus, lemon, raspberry, light funk. Taste is very acidic at this point, slight sour burn, some musty oak, tannic, sweet raspberry, pink lemonade. Finishes with high sourness, dusty old oak, musty attic, drying wood lingers with some sweet berry and light funk. Solid still but does not age well.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare. Golden light hazy with small laces. Nose has cheese, tart raspberries and some light acid. Taste has light balsamic, raspberries, smooth, cheesy, leather, barnyard and some cherries.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours unclear orange with a weak white head. Aroma of funk, cheese, raspberry, horse blanket, leather, deep oak and very tart overall. Complex aroma! The taste is funky and sour with notes of leather, raspberry, oak and weak cheese. Just a freaking good beer!

Bottle thanks to Bursprak! Thanks buddy! Pours hazy orange with a big white head. Aromas of apples, light funk, lactic tart, tart cherries,, white wine, vinegar, oak. Holy shit the aroma of this is great! Taste is lactic tart, green sour apples, tart cherries, vinegar, oaky, mouldy.
bottle from a share. exemplary brew, still getting my taste for sours, but this one was great, Superlatives all around.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak! Pours a cloudy orange with a small, white head. Aroma is leathery, slightly hoppy, funky, slight raspberry, cheese, extremely sour. Taste is burning sour as well, very sparkling, fruity, champagne with a hint of raspberry, oak and vanilla. Gets more fruity as it heats up. Very complex and very tart. High carb and crisp, sharp body.

(375ml bottle, 2013 vintage) Pours a hazy pinkish orange with a small pink/off-white head. Aroma of raspberries, oak, green apple, and lemon. Flavor of raspberries, minerals, oak, cherry, raisin, and lemon with a dry finish.
Clear pink, berry and oak funky town, very tart but not vinegar at all, very nice sour, berry, and oak finish, excellent
I love the bright pink color of this beer with the off white to light pink head. Full, raspberry nose with the same full flavor. Very effervescent and tart throughout.

Bottle thanks to chebyshev, shared with Luk. Bright pink pour with thin pinkish head. Aroma of fresh raspberry paste, jammy fruity notes, light citric (lemon) notes. Taste is tart, very fruity, fresh raspberries, nice fruity sweetness, light lemon acidity. P.alate is light, quite dry, good carbonation. Tasty
Smell is super nice raspberry sour. Taste is pretty much the same. Lots of raspberry sour deliciousness.

375ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy slightly reddish amber with an off-white head. Aroma of raspberries, some sourness, light oak and wine, some light malts, and hints of funkiness. Flavor the same with a nice blend of the raspberries and the sour beer. Average texture. A really good beer.

Ok. Finally here at 4000. I took almost all of 2014 off from rating and definitely have been slowing down since 2012 or so but here we are. The past few years have seen the sprouting of some many different and awesome sour/funky/wild/barrel aged themed breweries that Russian River has often gotten lost in the mix, even though they were one of true innovators of the sour style becoming so en vogue in America. So here we are. This beer is everything I want in an American fruit sour. Super funky while still retaining lots of fruit character. You can tell its a sour. But you can also tell what kind of fruit was used in it. Another great one here from Vinnie and the gang who helped to start it all. One day I will visit you, one day. And just say thanks.
Amazing sweet raspberry fragrance. Glowing pink with lasting thin white head. Sweettart sour raspberry flavor of awesome. Even leaves the powdered residue.

2014 bottle thanks to joenugs. Huge thanks for going to grab me one. Nose is pure berry and a light tartness to it, very inviting. Fruity esters play off the fruit in the beer. A light grassiness with some milky notes. Color is bright red to orange with a small tightly bubbled head. Taste is mouth puckering crazy with a bit of orange juice and a mouth watering sensation that dries out your cheeks and produces saliva at the same time. There is almost a bit of that taste right before you throw up. When your mouth starts watering and you swallow it in hopes of not puking. I have no idea what it is, but whatever I smelled is not in this beer. By the third sip, the front end of the beer become decent, while the finish is this acetic, tart mess that puckers while making me almost sick. Shit. This flavor is messed up. Even by the time my glass is halfway empty I still cant handle the finish. It has a soured milk taste to it. ugh.

375 ml bottle, gigantic thanks to Galen for sharing and Guidos for sending it back from the west coast! Unreal bright, vibrant, deep pink/ruby hue, roseate vivacious head. Nose and flavor hold bright, puckering sour raspberry, hints of tannic oak, raspberry seed, red wine vinegar, and hints of peach and stonefruit shining through somehow. Palate is just a touch thin, else this would be a completely ridiculous American take on a framboise. Check that, it still is, but not in the god tier.

Bottle: Poured alight reddish color ale with a nice off-white head with OK retention and light lacing notes. Taste of lightly tart fresh raspberry notes is very pleasant. Taste is also dominated by tart fresh raspberry notes with light acidic notes noticeable and light oak notes also perceptible. Body is about average with good carbonation. Great trade-off between sour notes and fresh fruit notes with good overall drinkability.

New years eve. Trade with AdamJackson. Pours hazy light pinkish red with a white foamy unstable head. Wood and fresh ripe raspberries. Dry and tart. Lovely blend and mixture - wood and raspberries. Extremely tasty.

Holy balls thats sour. Rose is color, fizzy, no head, super funk in the nose along with raspberries, cherries, and cranberry. The fruit flavor is there at the heart of it and thats a beautiful thing. Digging it for sure.

Bottle to glass. Pours a slightly hazy medium amber color with an off white head. Aroma is tart, dry, sweet berries. Flavor packs a huge sour, sour berries, slight sweetness in the back. Tart lingers long into the finish. Tingling on the tongue. Absolutely fantastic!

Sample at a tasting with Joris and Mathieu87. THX for sharing!
APPEARANCE: clear darker blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: raspberries, very fruity,oak.
TASTE: raspberries, very fruity, oak, very sour, perfect balance!
Nice gold pour. Vary nice tart fruit aroma. Flavor matches and is very balanced.

13 vintage bottle. Golden pour with subtle pinkish hues and a white head. Sour raspberry bouquet. Wowzers, that is one tart tata saver. Copious sour raspberry notes dominate. Undercurrents of caramel malts, oak, and vanilla. Maybe some vinous hints. Good body and mouthfeel.
Sampled during RBSG. From notes. Tart with loads of red fruits and a hint of grape skin. Solid oak notes.

Bottle from my boy Jarod, thanks man! Pour is clear pink with a thin pink foam. Aroma is sugary raspberry with light funk and light tartness. Aroma is wonderful. Flavor is sweet and tart up front with a distinct raspberry kick followed by more tartness and sweetness. Just a little NutraSweet flavor in there that i dont love. Overall very nice though.

Pours a very dark pink almost red color with pink head. Raspberries, and lots of them, with some oak, light fruited chardonnay wine, and funk on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes tart and dry. Rivals Atrial Rubicite from Jester King.

Bottle tanks to a trade! Pours a clear reddish pink with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a great sweet raspberry note with a bit of yogurt and a growing tartness. Flavor is much more sour with raspberry backed by a nice funk with a touch of yogurt.

Metallic orange beer; very well-carbonated under a very thick-set off-white head, lots of UFOs. Raspberry, yellow raspberry, lactic acid, Bretts and other wild yeasts. Quite sour, lactic acid and lemon. Finish is more mellow,  mals. Lemoncookies, no sweetness; Dry, dry-out effect, long-lasting flavours. Very nice - as expected, maybe. Yet, I preferred the 2012 version.  Many thanks to M & L V.!

Draft at Monks. Clear candy pink pour that nearly glows. Lasting white foam. Strong sweet and sour raspberry. Green grapes. Bit of pink vinyl. Slightly different character that past versions have had.
Deep red with a rich raspberry nose. Flavor wasnt as fruity as thr nose but crushable none the less. 2014 variant, very solid beer

Beautiful clear red pour at the brewery with just a slight white head. Nose is slightly raspberry. Its there but does not smack you in the face. Taste is really excellent. Tart, raspberry fruit, medium carbonation, sour and crisp.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a pink color without much head. Medium sour and a mild raspberry flavor.

Bottle from errl-thanks, Chris! Gorgeous light blood orange color, perfectly clear. Amazing fresh raspberry nose, with some light lacto, and bretty tropical fruit elements. White wine character, with perception of sweetness from the fruit, but clearly dry with a tart raspberry finish. Amazing stuff. Preferred over Atrial on flavor, though Atrial may have a better nose.

[ Bottle ][ ½ of 37.5cl ][ Tasting ][ Trade ][ Snifter ][ 9.24.14 ]Fiery grapefruit-gold, extremely effervescent, fizzy white head dies quick. Heavy seedy raspberry sweetness in nose, extremely low acid and bitterness, soft lactic and citric acids drowned slightly by extremely fizzy carbonation that leaves heavy mineral notes. Soft, lightly watery front palate, so fizzy the co2 bitterness and minerality dominate, considerable seed and sugar mid with fruit notes, arsenic aspects almost non-existent in doughy, puffy high-carbonated finish, more minerals, bit syrupy with fruit sweetness contrasted against high co2 bitterness. Warmth brings more lactic sourness and seed to balance the flavor, more-so than nose. Rough merging of elements, some high points, but its definitely a blend. [ 9.24 Tasting Ranking ]01. Sante Adairius Cask Strawberry02. Russian River FfaC 201303. De Garde Imperial Raspberry Bu04. De Garde Raspberry Bu 05. Dieu du Ciel dete aux Framboise06. Night Shift Cape Codder Weisse07. Night Shift Ever Weisse08. Firestone Walker Bretta Rose 09. Crooked Stave Raspberry Dark Origins10. Almanac Dogpatch Strawberry11. Night Shift Somer Weisse12. 1809 Berliner Weisse13. De Garde Imperial Strawberry Bu14. Firestone Walker Bretta Weisse

Bottle sample at a Sour Tasting at Beer and Beyond shop 22-June 2014. Thanks DSG. Pours orange to pink with a medium head, aroma of raspberry, funky with fruits and fresh leaves, flavor of raspberry, brett, funk, fresh leaves, lemon, amazingly aromatic, medium to full bodied, Outstanding.
just a tiny tiny bit less awesome than the first time I had this. still a little jammy without being thick or sweet with adequate tartness and sour pucker at the end. Hope they keep making this...
Bottle. Ruby pour with white head. Nice raspberry and tart aromas. Full raspberry, tart and funky flavors.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2014 Re rate during raspberry sour tasting.  Pour is amber orange with a pink hue and a small amount of tight white head.  Nose is fleshy raspberry, strong and bright, hints of oak and vanilla, just a touch of plastic phenol, not much else.  Taste comes together a little better and offers a touch more temptation, the raspberries are again bright and not sugary.  Semi sour finish, notes of leathery brett, a hint of acetic acid.  Probably best to drink sooner than later.

Pour is pinkish orange with a mostly white head. Nose is heavy fleshy rasp with notes of vanilla and some oak with hints of leather. Taste is a bit more rounded, very high carbonation and a dry finish. The fleshy raspberry had a nice balance or dusty cellar and notes of leather. Barrel and vanilla come in through the back.
Orange pour, silky white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose and taste are sour raspberries. Very pronounced raspberry. Smooth mouthfeel.
Bottle share at Tribes Alehouse. Pour is hazy pink with a small white head. Aroma and flavor raspberry, wheat, and sour mix. Finish is crisp and tart.

375 ml bottle at the Grand Tasting of RBSG. Pours a hazy pale rose-peach color with virtually no head. Notes of raspberries, tannins, florals, lemon, sweet malts, vanilla, and oak. Light-bodied, with medium carbonation and a tart, fruity mouthfeel. Doesnt have the raspberry load that past vintages have shown, but this is still excellent.
Sample at SRBG Grand Tasting. Thanks! Pours orange with a red tint. Has a small white head. Aroma of berries, fruit, and funk. Taste is raspberry, fruit, funk, and wood. Very nice. Very enjoyable.
Bottle. RBSG St. Louis Grand Tasting. Pours orange white head. Nose/taste of raspberry, oak, tart peach and red fruits. Medium body.

Bottle shared at a Sour/Wild tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks troganmi for this bottle! Pinkish orange with a white head. Wonderful strong raspberries aroma with oak, barnyard, a bit of lemon and zesty notes. Sour flavor full of funk, juicy raspberries, some other fruits, some oak and a lemony hint in the finish. Medium-bodied, lively carbonation. Amazing - delicious and extremely refreshing.
Bottle - Sour strawberries and yeast. Hazy gold with a thin white head. Tart and a long funky finish. Great beer and cause.
Sample at fauxbab. Raspberry and lemon. Quite tart and sour. Very carbonated.

This one poured a nice pinkish color with a white head. Aroma was of fresh raspberries, light lemon, and grain. Falvor was similar, tart raspberries, very clean, but the flavor drops off into an unfortunate dryness that keeps this one form being amazing.

Bottle shared thanks to beerman6686. Pours a pale clear pink color with a white foamy head. Sour aroma with some hay and slight raspberries. The raspberries are slightly faded at this point I am guessing. Taste is quite clean and tart. Slightly puckering. Very effervescent carbonation. Very enjoyable.

Enjoyed side by side with 2012. Interesting combo and I like this one a bit more.Pale grapefruit with a 1 finger head. Smells super jammy. Lots of hay. Raspberry for miles. Explosion of carbonation. Kind of vegetable. Very intensely sour but in a clean lambic way. Tart enamel stripping. Lots of fruit

At GABF 2013. Pours orange with slight red tint, medium fluffy head. Aroma is raspberry jam, cherry, raspberry, fruity tart. Taste is medium to high acidity, white vinegar, a ton of raspberry, tart cherries. Very nice beer

Thanks Nick! Never called a beer sexy before, but damn this is a fine looking beer. Nice soft red pink pour with a very light pink head. Aroma is tart raspberry, slight chardonnay. Taste is very refined and delicate. Tart raspberry, white wine, soft carbonation. This was a real treat.

375ml bottle thanks to Toby. Pours out a sexy pink topped with a light pink head. Nose is raspberry jam funk and some pucker. Taste is as the nose a nice berry note a great funk and pucker on the end. Taste

pours a bright pinkish red with a thin white head, effervescent. aroma of funk, oak, raspberries and white wine. taste is tart, raspberries, funk and oak. very carbed but not too over the top. this may be the best american representation of the style. really good

Bottle @ The HUGE Tasting. Cheers to Bruce for the pour. Hazy peach color with a small head. Honeyed raspberry tart. Nice and meaty, simple. The taste is similarly jammy, straight forward. Mild young tartness, a bit of brett. Green apple. Light body, soft carbonation. Great.
Huge bright tartness and jammy raspberry. lively carbonation and a really sharp lactic bite to the back end but it is nicely balanced by the sweet raspberry. Amazing stuff.

Bottle 375ml.
Pours slightly hazy salmon. Aroma is of fruits, sourness, flowers, raspberries. Taste is pretty much the same. The sourness is not overdone: much appreciated. Palate: Light body. Overall: Very good. Outstanding.

Bottle to taster (shared by GAbell). Looks good; a slightly hazy vibrant orange with white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells good too; oak, tartness, lacto, and raspberries. Tastes like it smells with a nice, lively mouthfeel. Great beer!

bottle shared by tom10101, many thanks! pours hazy bright golden-orange-pinkish with a very nice white head, good retention and creamy lacing. fresh raspberries bringing lightly citric notes, lambic funk bringing some lactic/acetic, grass, wood, hint of dust and vanilla - white cake-ish, slightly perfumey, but never disturbing. moderate carbonation, light body - oily, tart, dry and fresh fruity finish. this stuff is way out there. i heard that next year it will be 50% sonambic-made ;)  (okay, its in my dreams. excellent offering!

Bottle (375 ml). 2013. From Chris, thanks! Orange/golden color with reddish reflects and a small white head who quickly become a small ring of white foam. Aroma is of bright raspberries (both sour and sweet) with light acetic notes, hints of malt, oak, wine, light lactic notes and vanilla. Taste is also dominated by a ton of fresh and shining raspberries along with moderate sourness, nice wine presence, oak, light vanilla and a nice malt backbone. Light to medium body. Moderate carbonation. Winey mouthfeel. Slightly dry finish. Nice sourness, good complexity and great fruitiness. One of my favorite raspberry sour so far and so much better than last year version. World class!

38cl, Vintage 2013, new exclusive American brew, with raspberries, thx to John from bringing this over!, very complex sour fruit brew, sour/fruity and slightly woody/vinous, balanced, cloudy, small head, very good brew

Pour out of 375 mL, orange red pour with white head, aroma brought notes of raspberry, seed, some tannic notes, nice oak, lemon, tart fruit. Taste is a mix of raspberry, tart fruit, hints of lemon, berry, finishing tart, slight vanilla. Very nice, but lacking in fruit compared to other years.

375ml bottle acquired via trade on BA. Thanks. Pours a darker tangelo orange/cranberry mix. Gentle haziness, lively strong carbonation creates lots of streaming bubbles, cakey reddish tinged head atop stays as a cakey layer, sticks around well, laces suitably. Nice winter sunset glow, dulled and darker but pleasing. Aromas present a melange of fruit, big yogurty and sour pear, melon mix in. Citrus, white wine barrel and oak. Some vanillin, gentle funkiness and cobwebs. More fruit, some raspberry pulp works in slowly as it settles down, comes alive more. Pulpy raspberry and some cranberry as it warms, more yogurt, some nice lactic acidity starts to blossom. Nice stuff. Initial is lighter end of the fold, firmer yogurty and lactic sourness hits. Some bread, oak, white wine elements show gentle honeysuckle, crab apple and melon. White grape, raspberry skin and citrus. More sourness, twangy lactic sharpness, yogurt and some seedy raspberry as we start to work in, more citrus, some nice flashes of natural lemonade, raspberry skin and seedy fruit. Really nice stuff, lighter, fuzzy carbonation lifts this a bit. Good fruit complexity, firm to strong lactic presence. The Temptation part of the blend offers some good complexity, fruit and wine barrel. Subtle brett creeps in. The Beatification element really ups the sour component though, nice and citric and lactic elements, nothing overdone. The raspberries compliment well, but do seem to fall behind that Beatification smack. Finish shows some decent raspberry, a bit of a blend between skin and seedy fruit, lingering yogurt, house funk and cobwebs. Gentle cheesecloth, white wine. Tasty, complex stuff. Nose could use the ante upped a bit, but overall this is quite nice and a nice new take on the FFAC Yearly Blend. Two different beers really come together well, seem expertly blended.
Wow this is awesome, huge huge raspberry flavor and aroma. Tons of fruit and tartness, very nicely balanced

3rd January 2013Mega tasting at Bruces pad. Thanks to the man himself for another Brucie bonus! Lightly hazy gold beer, small white head. Light palate, semi dry and crispy. Little peachy grapefruit! Mild tartness. Light dry finish. Nice peach! Shouldnt I be tasting raspberries? Oh dear - mebbe I drunk to much by now!

Bottle. Off the menu offering from Bruce at that crazy mega tasting. Massive thanks to the host! It pours deep red-amber with a small white head. The nose is fresh raspberry, tart cranberry, tart green apple. sherbet goodness and wood. The taste is crisp, tart, sherbet, raspberry, hit of acidity, lemon, Granny smith apple, citrus peel and wood with a dry, tart finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Great balance. Pretty freaking delicious if truth be told!

bottle. initial aroma of jammy raspberries, some strawberries in greek yogurt. hint of apricot. simple, clean. taste is bright, moderate-heavy clean lemon juice and yogurt sourness. touch too much biting sourness without a sweet enough fruit presence to fully compensate. finishes with lemon yogurt unripened strawberry fruit. dry. this sonambic and high dose of lemon acidity? not much offered in the leathery funk department. clean, straightforward fruited lemon yogurt brew. preferred the more balanced FFAC with temptation base from previous years (without sonambic).

Bottle shared at the Kenny - stop smashing Bruces table every 9 fucking minutes tasting, massive thanks to Bruce for digging this one out 03/01/14.
Hazed golden orange/amber with a moderate off white head.
Nose is tarte fruit, woody, dank must, tarte raspberry, berry fruit dipped straw, citric waft, lemon rind.
Taste comprises bitter raspberries, dank berry fruit skins, red grape notes, tarte cherry, light cobwebs, hay, light citric bitterness.
Medium boided, fine carbonation, massaging, top palate.
Excellent sour, well balanced and packed with tangy berry fruit flavour!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: JAN 10, 2014 Gone off the list again for the big tasting. Cheers to Bruce for getting out one of the best beers of the night. Pours hazy pink with a light red beige sort of head leaving sticky legs down the glass. Nose is very tangy stuff - citrus focus, hay and sweet tarty berries. Taste is citrus rind, very tarty, slight sugar, big raspberry and ripe berry sweetness. Nice tangy lemon and tangerine notes at the back end. The tarty berries are the winner here though. Very clean. Great stuff

Bottle shared in London to celebrate good times. Pours hazy, pink gold with creamy white head. Lovely pink grapefruit in the nose, faint tangy citrus. Light sweetness, gorgeous, mellowed berries, faint citric tang. 
Ought to medium bodied with fine carbonation and creamy mouthfeel. Clean finish with pale cherry, raspberry, lemon, mandarin orange. Delicious, very well balanced. Exquisite.
Definite raspberry aroma raspberry in the initial favor a slight tart. Ya got some oak going on, vinegar backfeel and nice mouthcoating dryness. Somewhat low carbonation overall an outstanding beer.

Bottle @ The Bruery, thanks to GT. Hazed pink pour with a nice white head. Aromas of raspberry, lemon juice, and some subtle musty funk. Oak, grass, and green apple skin. A bit of honey, lime zest, and a bit of seedy fruit. Good tartness to the flavor. Subtle honey and raspberry sweetness. Oak, grass, green apple, and lime. Mild funk, tons of fruit, and lemon juice.

Bottle thanks to GT2. Pours with a clear, peachy to rose hued body with a small white head that fizzes away in acidity. Aromas are very fruity, raspberry, light tropical and brett produced esters, vinous, light wine, citric components. Zesty, lower levels of funk. Flavors are tart, lots of jammy raspberry with tannic seed notes, medium and refined funk, light wine. Not hugely acidic, and because of that, highly drinkable. Very sharp and lively carbonation, very dry as well. I wish this were more accessible as it is insanely easy to drink.

375mL, rating #7100, big thanks to Jazzz for the mega hookup here! Pours clear light orange/pink with fizzing out white acid cut foam. Nose at first is volatile chlorine, but thankfully opens up into something spot on with Temptation white wine barrel at full force, flashes of seedy raspberry, bright pineapple, sharper Brett. Taste is full bright lime, intensely seedy raspberry, salty and bright. Full lactic finish with intensity and completeness. Refreshing, zippy. Spot on. Could drink a lot more than this- shame it comes in a small format and has to be for a special occasion instead of just a summer quencher.
Lots of sour vinegar, dominated by lacto, the raspberries as a fresh fruit dimension. As always well-done.
Bottle. Wow. Beautiful pinkish red. Aroma and taste are super heavy on raspberry. Great balance between sweet and tart. Beautiful delicate palate. Hard to imagine a better frambois. Incredible.

Aroma: Fresh Raspberry, Mild Tart Cherry

Appearance: Bright Ruby Hue, Passes Some Light, Pink Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Raspberry, Cranberry, Mild Tart Cherry

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Tart

Lots and lots of pours at GABF. Nice reddish pink color, white head with pink tinges. Raspberries, yogurt,sour goodness! Just a very well balanced and juicy sour. Id say this was the best rendition since batch 1. Awesome.

Sampled at GABF2013. Pours a rich red with a nice little pink head. Aroma of raspberries, funk, yogurt, mild vinegar and lactic notes. Tart and sour, with wet wood and lemon notes. Flavor is quite sour with nice raspberry tartness. Prickly carbonation, medium bodied. Finishes nice and sour. Lovely sour.

Bottle- Huge Thanks to Paz for this 1k rate..Gusher! Pour is a soft pale pink with a thin white head,,.Nose is yogurt, oak, raspberries, tartness, light sweetness..Taste is fresh raspberries, funk, berries ,oak, yogurt, horseblanket, nice carbonation..

Draft @ GABF 2013. Pours a hazy pale pinkish golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity sour tart weak woody raspberry aroma. Fruity sour tart woody raspberry flavor. Has a fruity sour tart raspberry finish.

Bright red body, delicate pink head. Huge burst of raspberries in the aroma, so fresh and juicy. Crisp, fruity, delicious, nicely balanced with the oak & sourness. Minimal funk at the end. Dregs add a touch more intensity. Delicious.
Bottle thanks to Scott. Pours a cloudy pink with off white head. The aroma is strong raspberry and funk. Thin mouthfeel with strong tart raspberry and sourness. Really enjoyed this one.

Draft at Toronado SD. Pours bright pink color with thin white head. Aroma is fruity, raspberry, a little funky. Medium on the palate with lively carbonation. Flavor is sweet and tart, raspberry, some wheat, some funky yeast, some lemon citric, with a light, tart finish. Excellent.

Sample at GABF - In one of the longest lines at the festival, I went a couple of times for this real treat. Mostly clear pinkish color with white head. Nose is full of raspberries and other berries, brett, fresh clean tartness. Taste is big tart raspberry, barrel, funk. Hells yea.

On tap at the brewery. Gorgeous pink-purple color, vivid fresh raspberry aroma. The Temptation base is obvious, with that citric vinous acidity going on, plus a load of luscious berries. Dry and light on the palate with a cutting tartness. Great stuff.
Sampled at a gabf. from my notes. pours a dark pink with a pink head. big raspberry aroma and taste.
Off tap at Russian River. Pours a red pink. Aromas of tart raspberries. Tastes of tart raspberries. Awesome!

On tap at Monks Cafe. Wow, just a great Framboise. Raspberries are dominant in the aroma. Pour is orange and pink. Beautiful beer for an awesome cause. Sour and so good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at monks wih Vinny, Ryan, Eric, and Alan. Aroma is raspberry jelly candy beans. Slightly floral and perfumey. Mouthfeel is medium and lightly carbonated with notes of raspberry jelly, rose flowers, dry acidity and muted tart fruit.

On tap at Monks with some heady brahs. Poured hazy pinkish red with light head and not much lacing. Aromas and flavor of raspberry, cranberry, perfume, rose petals, cranberry and wood. Light carbonation. Tart finish.

Pinkish red body, thin off white head, minimal lacing. Nose shows raspberry preserves and floral notes, light must. Flavor is more juicy and seedy, some cherry and cranberry as well. Light tannins and oak. Medium bodied, assertive acidity, somewhat clipped finish. Nice.

GABF 2013. Pours a pinkish red appearance with a pink head. Jesus, the aroma is full of seedy raspberries, tart vinous notes, wood, and funk. Bright raspberries, a touch earthy, sour fruity flavor. Boy, this one was a real pleasure to drink. Really hope to try it again.
On tap at GABF 2013, big grapefruit, tart and light fruit aroma and taste, super nice finish.

Draft @ Russian River. Pours a deep ruby-red color; a thin off-white, light-pin head persists. A bit hollow in the nose, even relative to previous batches; a bit of wet cardboard followed by deep, ripe raspberry notes. Medium body with lively co2; mouthwatering berry-driven acidity and tartness; a full, expansive fruit character and sourness; a touch simple, though, relative to RRs other sours (per usual). Lightly dry finish with moderate raspberry tartness.

GABF 2013 
Aroma is acidic, fruity and grapes  Flavors of sour fruit, acidic with a dry finish 
Very nice
Sampled at GABF 2013. Fresh raspberries, tart fruity aroma with wine and wild yeast. Fruity, tart and sour. Quite refreshing.

(Sampled at GABF - Several pours) Clear medium pink color with a soapy white head. Nose of fresh raspberries, dried fruit, woody, brett, heavy on tartness, no vinegar here. Taste is all raspberry and fresh raspberry puree, wood, brett, spices and other tart fruit. No vinegar for me, just a nice tart fruit sour. Prickly carbonation and refreshing.
Sampled at GABF 2013. Pours hazy orange golden with a pinkish head. Aroma of big tart raspberries and light funk. Flavour is heavy acidic. Medium bodied with light carbonation.
Pours orange with pink hue. Notes of raspberries and vineager. Moderately tart, barely sweet.

Sample @ GABF 13. Pours a clear pink beer with a thin layer of off white head on top. Aroma of raspberries, tart, oak and such. Flavour is in your face sour. Not much fruity influences going on. Dry, tart finish. Long lasting.

Pour at GABF. Appearance is clear orangish-pink with a frothy white head and great lacing. Funky, bretty, woody, big raspberries, cranberries, and a hint of blueberry in the aroma. Taste is big oak, brett, a light hint of spice, cranberry, red wine vinegar, and tart raspberries with a lightly sour finish. Light body with high carbonation. Really nice stuff. I will definitely be seeking out some bottles of this.
On draft at the GABF 2013. Pours a clear copper with an off white finish. Barnyard nose. Flavors of tart fruit with only a hint if raspberry. Tart finish.

On tap at the brewpub. It pours a nice light pinkish color with a white/pink head. The aroma is bright and clean with a sharp tartness, hints of raspberries and salty leather. The flavor is similarly sharp and intensely sour but not vinegary or very funky. Super fresh tasting and mouthwatering with a great pucker. Minerals and more salty leather in the finish. The sonambic part of the blend takes over big time even though its only 20% of the beer. Raspberries are in balance and provides a nice accent without being the main attraction. I love it right now, but Im curious how this will age.

On tap at the brewpub.
Aroma is full of bright ripe raspberries with a light funkiness and moderate acidity. Acidity adds a touch of a citrus character. Light funk reminds me of walking through a raspberry farm (yes I have done this). 
Pours a bright reddish pink with hints of orange. Medium light pink head that is moderately thick and has nice retention and lacing.
Flavor is has a light tartness right away, but that is followed by a hint of sweet raspberries. The sweetness washes away and you get hit with lots of tart berry character. light citrus acidity notes and some medium light Brett character which should develop nicely with time. Brett adds hints of barnyard and pineapple.
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low acidic astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a very enjoyable framboise with lots of fresh, tart fruit. The acidity and Brett character is presently more of a background character, but has the potential to develop very nicely.

Tap @ Russian River, twice. Pours hazy neon hot pink with a small pink head that has decent retention and good lacing. Aroma is raspberries with obvious funky notes from the Beat. Quite nice. Flavor is funkier than last year, nice tartness and enough funk to be interesting but not overwhelm. Raspberries are present, but do not overwhelm. Body is medium, carbonation is good. Definite improvement over last year!

On tap at the brewpub in Santa Rosa, CA. Smells of raspberries, of course. Tastes of sour raspberries, but no too overbearing on the sour. Nicely done.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Multiples on tap at RR. Aroma is straight raspberries, some funk, definitely Beat-smelling. Flavor has a nice sour pucker to it...part Sonambic base with the Temptation this time. It really makes this version of the beer stand apart. Amazing beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375ml bottle (2013 release). Pours a reddish copper color with a slightly pinkish head. Acidic, tart, nice amount of raspberry flavor comes through, some oak. Another very well done sour from RRBC. Great beer for a great cause. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
